page.title: 07HIGHWAYS AND BYWAYS
page.content: The main road through the Dale is the A684. Running east-west from Northallerton to Kendal it follows the Ure's south bank through this area. The erstwhile turnpike from Richmond to Lancaster runs to the north of the Ure. The two are joined by smaller roads crossing the Ure from Worton and Bainbridge. The Roman road from Brough Roman Fort (Virosidum) to Lancaster is still visible. Traffic on the A684 has increased considerably in the past few years, especially as a result of tourism. A recent decision of the County Council to apply for an upgrading of the road has led to fierce local opposition by those who fear that the further increase in traffic will destroy the character of the Dale and its villages.
